intro: Kaempferia marginata, commonly known as the white ginger lily, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features strap-shaped, bright green leaves and produces clusters of pale yellow to white, fragrant flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil and partial to full shade. Kaempferia marginata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
